intro: Leucocyclus formosus, commonly known as the Taiwan leucocyclus, is a rare flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, white to pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it has a short, stout stem. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in its native region.
